data.title: Empower Africa on LinkedIn: TomorrowNow Secures $5 Million to Impact 20 Million Farmers in Africa With‚Ä¶
data.meta_description: TomorrowNow.org, a non-profit organization dedicated to enhancing climate resilience in Africa, has secured an additional $5 million grant from the Bill &‚Ä¶
data.text:
One Acre Fund, a champion for smallholder farmers in Africa, has secured a $1.4M investment from Impact Bridge Asset Management SGIIC. The funding will empower an additional 1 million farmers to improve their livelihoods and boost food security. Wishing both One Acre Fund and Impact Bridge continued success in their mission to create a sustainable future. This impact leader aims to transform the lives of over 500 million children through localized edutainment by 2030. She is transforming educational experiences for millions of children by providing quality educational content through TV, radio, and mobile phones Meet Mwasi Wilmore. She is the CEO of Ubongo, Africa‚Äôs premier edutainment platform for children. And today, we feature her in our series of the #AfricanChangeMakers series. Village Capital is investing $850,000 in two African agritech startups, AquaRech LTD (Kenya) and CoAmana (Nigeria). Aquarech is addressing challenges faced by fish farmers by offering a buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) solution for fish feed. Coamona, founded in 2018, is digitizing farmer management processes. Huge congratulations to Village Capital, Aquarech, and Coamana on this partnership! Aruwa Capital Management, a leading early-stage growth equity fund, has announced a follow-on investment in AgroEknor, a prominent hibiscus flower exporter and wellness brand. This renewed commitment follows AgroEknor‚Äôs impressive growth trajectory since Aruwa‚Äôs initial investment in December 2022. Congratulations to both Aruwa and AgroEknor on this exciting partnership! This Nigerian social entrepreneur developed Nigeria‚Äôs first publicly available e-learning platform for traditional birth attendants. He created the platform in response to the high rates of maternal and infant mortality in Nigeria, particularly in rural and underserved areas. The platform later evolved to the development and distribution of Clean Birth Kits, which include essential sterile items such as gloves, antiseptic soap, and sterilized delivery mats. Meet Dr. Abiodun Adereni. He is the Founder and CEO of HelpMum Africa, an organization committed to improving maternal and child health in Nigeria. Today, we feature him in our series of the #AfricanChangeMakers series. Adetoun Adereni Parminder Vir OBE Arit Edem Opadele Kehinde Beatrice Dr. Blessing Animasahun Janet Olaniyan Corinne Namblard Afolabi Hannah Abdulquddus Ajibade Oluwaseun Odunsi Learn more about his inspiring journey and impactful work üëâ https://lnkd.in/dHzScm7k #empowerafrica #africa #investinafrica #MaternalHealth #ChildHealth #HealthcareInnovation #TechForGood #SafeChildbirth #AfricanInnovators #SocialImpact #MaternalMortality #CommunityHealth

This Moroccan private equity executive has helped close to 250 companies secure funding. His efforts are not limited to financial support. He also focuses on providing strategic guidance and implementing robust governance practices to ensure sustainable growth for these businesses. His work has been crucial in bridging the gap in financing and strategic support for SMEs and mid-cap companies across North and Sub-Saharan Africa. Meet Hatim Ben Ahmed. He is the Managing Partner and co-founder of Mediterrania Capital Partners, a private equity firm dedicated to growth investments in SMEs and mid-cap companies. He is also the President of the Moroccan PE & VC Association - AMIC , where he aims to enhance the role of private equity in supporting Moroccan entrepreneurs and revitalizing the economy. Today, we feature him in our series of the #AfricanChangeMakers. African Fintechs on the Global Stage! üî• 6 African fintech firms are among those recognized in CNBC's prestigious list of the world's top 250 fintech companies for 2024! The six include: ‚úÖ PalmPay (Nigeria) - Driving financial inclusion with its comprehensive fintech platform. ‚úÖ Flutterwave (Nigeria/US) - Simplifying cross-border payments. ‚úÖ Kuda (Nigeria/UK) - Revolutionizing digital banking. ‚úÖ MTN (South Africa) - Transforming mobile money services. ‚úÖ Piggyvest (Nigeria) - Promoting financial planning and literacy. ‚úÖ Yoco (South Africa) - Empowering small businesses with accessible payment solutions. Congratulations to them.
